definition: a verbal formula believed to have magical force, take turns working
details:
noun
- a verbal formula believed to have magical force
= example: a verbal formula believed to have magical force
= synonyms: charm
- a psychological state induced by (or as if induced by) a magical incantation
= synonyms: trance
- a period of indeterminate length (usually short) marked by some action or condition
= synonyms: patch
- a time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
= synonyms: turn
verb
- take turns working
= example: take turns working
- indicate or signify
= example: indicate or signify
= synonyms: import
- orally recite the letters of or give the spelling of
= example: orally recite the letters of or give the spelling of
= synonyms: spell out
- place under a spell
- write or name the letters that comprise the conventionally accepted form of a word or part of a word
= example: write or name the letters that comprise the conventionally accepted form of a word or part of a word
= synonyms: write
- relieve someone from work by taking a turn
= example: relieve someone from work by taking a turn
